snippet: As the government rested its case, one of its last witnesses, a venture capitalist, testified how he helped Mr. Silver invest hundreds of thousands of dollars.
abstract: Federal prosecutors rest their case in corruption trial of former New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver with witness who testifies about helping Silver transfer over $300,000 into Silver's wife's name; prosecutors say testimony shows Silver attempted to conceal money gained from bribery schemes.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: As the government rested its case, one of its last witnesses, a venture capitalist, testified how he helped Mr. Silver invest hundreds of thousands of dollars.

headline.main: Jury Hears Where Sheldon Silver’s Money Went as U.S. Rests Case
headline.print_headline: Jury Hears Where Silver’s Money Went as U.S. Rests Case
